p: Dengue is caused by any of four antigenically distinct dengue virus serotypes, designated DENV-1, DENV-2, DENV-3, and DENV-4, which are transmitted by Aedes (Ae. ) mosquito species. Dengue has become a major international public health concern and over the past decade the number of outbreaks has escalated and the population at risk is increasing yearly [ 1â€“ 4]. More than 3.5 billion people are at risk of DENV infection and it has been estimated that there are 390 million DENV infections every year [ 5].
